name: Holiday Inn Express Phoenix Airport (University Drive)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a room in Phoenix because we were flying out in the morning. The room was spotless and inviting. And quiet- a plus when you're staying near an airport! We weren't travelling with a laptop so the courtesy computer in the lobby allowed us to check-in with our airline the night before. A free breakfast in the morning is always a bonus when you're not sure when you'll next grab a bite to eat. Being celiac, I always have questions that need answering before I can eat what's offered and the woman responsible for the food prep was genuinely helpful and unperturbed by my questions. This will be our go-to hotel whenever we fly out of Phoenix.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay when you're flying out in the morning.

reviews.text: I loved staying at this hotel. It was very clean, the staff was friendly and the service was more then what I expected from a hotel at this price range. The one thing I would warn you about is the restaurant recommendation list. We went to the restaurant at the top of the list (Casey Moore's Ouster House) and it was, well, less than classy, a little smelly and just a typical college bar/restaurant/hangout joint. May I suggest the following local Phoenix restaurants for your stay : La Grande Orange (great pizza, wings and red velvet cake), That's a Wrap (fresh wraps), and Lola's Cafe (local coffee roaster that does latte art). Other than that picky little thing, the hotel staff was extremely helpful and I would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Don't follow the restaurant recommendation list.

reviews.text: I stayed here on 5/31/2011 in room 428; paying $100.81 total. Booked the hotel based on TA reviews and the need for a shuttle to Phoenix SkyHarbor the next morning. I travel about once a month for pleasure; this was my last night after a three week trip. Having read the other TA reviews I was aware that the only restaurant close by was a Waffle House so I had dinner down off University prior to checking in, (numerous restaurants can be found around ASU). I was traveling alone and felt very safe in this location and in this hotel. Very pleased with the room, the hotel, and the staff I came in contact with during my stay. I was flying out the next afternoon and, as a Priority Club Member, was offered a late checkout. It wasn't needed but was appreciated. Checked in around 8 p.m. - checkin was quick and my request for a room on the highest floor away from the elevator was met.
reviews.title: Best HIE I've stayed in!

reviews.text: Room was very clean (including curtains, window, behind doors, etc.), everything was in very good order, didn't use the fridge or microwave but they were available, large flat screen TV, appreciated the toiletries and better than average towels in the room, above average hotel breakfast with a very courteous staff member keeping the area neat/clean/stocked, comfortable bed, and quiet room. Did not use the pool but, upon inspection, saw it was very clean and all seemed to be in good repair. Towels were set out for the guests to use on each chair; found myself wishing I had brought my bathing suit. :-)
reviews.title: Good place to stay and free parking while traveling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been traveling three weeks at this time, had stayed in seven different hotels (3 being HIE), and had one of the best nights sleep I had in over three weeks. I often post pictures of the rooms I stay in but my room honestly looked like the pictures on the website. I always wipe down any handles, switches, remote, phone, etc.of any hotels I stay in - all were clean. Checked the bed - all the linens/mattress were in good shape and were clean. Took the free shuttle to the airport; very courteous driver and very prompt service. My only *wish* was the opportunity to purchase a secured wifi network (i.e. AirLock, etc.). I would highly recommend this hotel. If in the area again, I will be staying at this Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Quite, near airport and excellent value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night before an early morning flight out of Phoenix. The room was large and very clean, and the bed was very comfortable with a choice of soft or firm pillows labelled for us to choose. We had 2 drinks compliments of the hotel, and a wonderful breakfast. We had a great sleep, no noise from other rooms, and the window opened so we enjoyed some fresh air.
reviews.title: Great spot for an early morning flight

reviews.text: Stayed one night while awaiting flight the next day out of Sky Harbor. Staff were friendly. Room was clean. Overall appearance of hotel was acceptable. Beds were comfortable. Water pressure for shower was super! Plenty of places to eat nearby either walking or driving. Would/Will definitely stay here again without hesitation. Can't comment on the food as we left too early in the morning to eat.....lol.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the Money!

reviews.text: When we checked into our one, first floor room with two beds, the carpet was soaking wet throughout the room. The young lady at the desk agreed to change us to two separate rooms also on the first floor, but they had the same problem. She moved us to the second floor, two rooms with king beds at no additional charge. A bit of a delay as we had to keep moving our luggage, but she did the right thing. The rest of the stay was great with a late checkout until 2PM which was very helpful.
reviews.title: Corrected the problem for us

reviews.text: Eat & drink @ allied Hilton Garden Hotel next door & put it on your hotel bill ! - lots of bar company
reviews.title: Real friendly hotel & great breakfast

reviews.text: I stayed one night at this hotel prior to an early morning flight out of Sky Harbor Airport. I chose this hotel because of the reasonable price ($89) and the ability to leave my vehicle there for up to two weeks while traveling. The room was nicely furnished, the blackout drapes did their job, the bed was comfortable and it was exactly what I expected from a Holiday Inn Express. Next door is a Hilton Garden Inn that, according to the desk clerk, is owned by the same person who owns the Holiday Inn Express. The Hilton has a full-service restaurant open for lunch and dinner and Holiday Inn guests can charge their meals to their room. This was a great convenience since the only restaurant close by is a Waffle House directly in front of the hotel. I had a salmon dinner that was excellent. My flight the next morning left too early for me to have breafast at the Holiday Inn Express, so I can't comment on the breakfast. I utilized the Holiday Inn Express shuttle service, which begins at 4:00 a.m.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel for you and your vehicle

reviews.text: I had a last minute lay over in AZ. and need a room quick and close to the airport. I opened my laptop and searched Holetls near the Phoenix airport and found the Holiday in to have a reasonable price and asfree shutttle to and from the hote. I booked it last minute and was supprise to see what a great hotel it was. The breakfast in the morning was a great start for my flight into Los Angeles.
reviews.title: Excelent Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night at either end of our trip to Arizona and beyond. The hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was fine, and all the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient stopover

reviews.text: We didn't get a chance to use the swimming pool, but it looked nice.
reviews.title: Nice clean property in quiet business park

reviews.text: On our return leg we ate a very decent meal at the HIE's sister property ( Holiday Garden Inn) restaurant despite arriving only 5 minutes before their closing time. This was much appreciated after a long drive from LA.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and close to the airport

reviews.text: The hotel has a very convenient shuttle to and from the airport. We had just the loveliest chatty driver when we first arrived and were thrilled to see him again when we left Arizona. I'm afraid I failed to note his name,sorry, but if he's reading this, thank you once again for your welcome and good humour from the French family with the two girls!
reviews.title: We use this hotel every month.

reviews.text: Very nice HIE. Internet worked very well and the room was up to date and clean. Shower and bathroom were fine. Nice outdoor pool in the rear of the property. Very reasonably priced on weekends I guess. From the outside the place looks well maintained and the AC worked as best as could be expected during this record heat wave.
reviews.title: Such a nice and enjoyable stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night while passing thru Phoenix last weekend. We got to the hotel about 2 hours early and decided to see if we could check in early. The staff said it was no problem and checked us quickly in. Hotel was clean and room was nice and cool on a 100 degree day. The hotel seemed to be in a nice safe location. Looked like a business area but there was a Waffle House right next door. Very quick access to the interstate as well. Very nice hotel, would stay at again if going to Phoenix.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Good quiet location

reviews.text: Being in the hospitality business, you see a lot. There are some things that are not within a hotel's control, such as a city's temporary shut-off of water, etc. Service, however is paramount, and as a supervisor of mine always puts it, "A room is a room, is a room. Guests want great service."
reviews.title: OK rooms, below average service

likes.liked: — comfy beds with nice mattresses and sheets

reviews.text: At check in for a weekend we weren't really greeted but checked into our room. We made it to the happy hour and requested a gin and tonic, but they were out of tonic water. A vodka and orange juice? No orange juice. My friend joked,"OK what can we have?" The response was,"Well you're a little late for cocktail hour, so you're lucky you're getting anything." I looked at his face for some sign of jest, but he was serious.
reviews.title: very pleasantly surprised

likes.disliked: — few eating establishments in the area

reviews.text: The next night after requesting a ride on their complementary shuttle for a night out on the town, we were turned down because it was considered outside of their service zone. The clerk at the desk scoffed while letting us know, but called a cab for us.
reviews.title: Good Hotel after flight

reviews.text: Rooms here are comfortable, and reflect an updated Holiday Inn look. Beds are very comfy.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: We spent the night at Holiday Inn Express in order to be able to leave on an early flight the next morning. Rooms were very clean and well-equipped, and we enjoyed the hot breakfast. I also enjoyed the free shuttle to the airport. All of this for a reasonable rate!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: We needed a hotel for one night to make a connection to the airport.
reviews.title: Ok for one night

reviews.text: Due to the fact our plane was leaving early (very) we choose the hotel, it had free airport transport, and was nearby.
reviews.title: Good Place to stay if need to be near airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a more expensive (almost double) than the one we had stayed on our way in (Holiday Inn Express in Scottsdale) but I thought it was worth it.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay but communication snafus abound!

reviews.text: I was wrong.
reviews.title: Useful stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in September after a long haul flight. We wanted somewhere comfortable, that was near the airport so we could pick up the hire car easily the next morning. The holiday inn fitted the bill perfectly, the price is very reasonable considering the size of the rooms and the hotel staff are happy to arrange free shuttle transfers to and from the airport or car hire depot. Our room was a king suite, was very clean and had a huge, extremely comfortable bed. We weren't very hungry so the waffle house next door to the hotel was sufficient for us, apparently there is a restaurant in the hotel next door for more substantial meals. The complimentary breakfast is very nice and has a wide selection of breads, pastries and cereals, as well as eggs and bacon. Check-in was fast and efficient and the staff were helpful and friendly. There is a PC in the foyer which guests can use to access the internet. If you're looking for a hotel near the airport before or after a flight then I highly recommend the Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express the last day of our trip home to Massachusetts, I wish we had stayed longer. The staff at the front desk was very accomodating getting us our room earlier than check in time. Also, front desk was helpful to us with info about bringing our car back to airport, (which by the way was the worst part of our vacation.) The evening gathering in the lobby had 2 free drinks per guest which was a nice touch.I also took advantage of the laundry area to do vacation laundry. The rooms were large and very clean. The free shuttle to the airport the next morning was right on time and accomodating. I think the staff at this hotel gets a high 5 for service.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: My son and I needed a clean, comfortable hotel near Sky Harbor. I got lucky by choosing this Hoilday Express.
reviews.title: 100% satisfied!!

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable and close to Sky Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Iwas told it was recently remodeled. It looked and felt that way. Cost was about $120.00 total.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds were very comfortable. Clean. Quiet. My son made the comment on how the room seemed to maintain a constant temperature. It was 115 degrees outside.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Express Phoenix Airport (University Drive) Hotel Phoenix
description: Whether you are in Phoenix for business or pleasure, the newly-renovated Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Phoenix Airport has all the comforts and conveniences you expect from luxury airport hotels. Centrally located near Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, our location gives easy access to downtown Phoenix and Tempe, including the new Phoenix Light Rail, Chase Field, Phoenix Civic Plaza Convention Center, Sun Devil Stadium, Tempe Town Lake, Phoenix Zoo, US Air Arena, Arizona State University, University of Phoenix, Levin Group, and Ewing Irrigation.This 4-story hotel features 114 beautifully appointed guest rooms and free high-speed (wired & wireless) Internet service. You may also enjoy our complimentary happy hour Monday - Friday, or 'park and fly' and eliminate worries of high airport parking rates. Nearby you will find Mill Avenue, Arizona Mills Shopping Mall, award-winning golf courses, restaurants & nightlife, and casinos.You will find yourself amazed with our award-winning service, convenient location, and spacious guest rooms featuring our Stay Smart bedding collection, microwaves, refrigerators, expanded cable and free HBO. Don t forget our complimentary freshly prepared breakfast buffet, including a variety of hot items like sausage, sausage gravy, omelets or biscuits. Upcoming events: NBA All Stars February 2009 and NASCAR April 2009.
